Sure! Here are some tips for remembering to do your exercises daily:

1. Set a reminder on your phone or calendar: Set a daily reminder to do your exercises at a specific time that works for you. This will help you establish a routine and make it a habit.

2. Pair it with a daily routine: Associate your exercises with a daily task, such as brushing your teeth or eating breakfast. This will help you remember to do them consistently.

3. Find an exercise buddy: Partner up with someone who also wants to improve their posture or reduce back pain. You can motivate and remind each other to do your exercises daily.

4. Keep your exercise equipment in a visible place: Keep your exercise equipment, such as a yoga mat or resistance band, in a visible place as a reminder to do your exercises.

5. Reward yourself: Set a small reward for yourself after completing your exercises. This can be something as simple as a healthy snack or a few minutes of relaxation afterwards.

Hopefully these tips will help you establish a consistent exercise routine and improve your posture and reduce back pain.
